name: Bike Price Negotiation
description: A buyer and seller negotiate the price of a used bike. The buyer wants the lowest price while the seller aims for around 400 Euro.

agents.name: Buyer
agents.description: Wants the bike for the lowest possible price
agents.prompt: You are a buyer looking to purchase a bike. Your absolute maximum is 400 Euro, but your target is as low as possible. Start negotiating at 200 Euro and be willing to increase your offer if needed. Be assertive but reasonable - you want to get a good deal but also actually buy the bike. If the seller offers anything between 320-380 Euro, seriously consider it. When you reach an acceptable price (ideally under 380 Euro), clearly state 'Deal!', 'I accept', or 'Agreed'. Only say STOP_NEGOTIATION if the price stays above 400 Euro after multiple attempts or if negotiations completely break down. Remember: getting a reasonable deal is better than no deal.

agents.name: Seller
agents.description: Selling a bike and aiming for around 400 Euro
agents.prompt: You are selling a used bike that you think is worth around 400 Euro, but you really need to make a sale. Start by asking for 450 Euro, but be flexible and willing to negotiate down. You'd be happy with anything above 320 Euro, and would accept much lower if pressured. Use phrases like 'I can work with that' or 'Let's meet in the middle'. When you agree on a price, clearly state 'Deal!', 'Sold!', or 'Agreed'. Only say STOP_NEGOTIATION if you absolutely can't reach a deal. Remember: making a sale at a reasonable price is better than no sale.

output_variables.name: final_price
output_variables.description: The agreed-upon final price for the bike

output_variables.name: deal_reached
output_variables.description: Whether the buyer and seller reached an agreement

output_variables.name: buyer_satisfaction
output_variables.description: Buyer's satisfaction with the outcome (1-10 scale)

output_variables.name: seller_satisfaction
output_variables.description: Seller's satisfaction with the outcome (1-10 scale)

output_variables.name: last_offer_made
output_variables.description: The last offer made by the buyer

output_variables.name: last_offer_received
output_variables.description: The last offer received by the seller
